feed.title: Hosted Private Cloud Status - Incident History

entry.title: [Global][VMware Private Cloud] - vCenter minor upgrade
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jan 16, 2023, 07:00 UTC  -  Jan 19, 2023, 17:00 UTC

Dec 20, 22:13 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 16/01/2023 07:00 UTC
End time : 19/01/2023 17:00 UTC
Service impact : The management plane will be unavailable for 1 hour during the maintenance schedule.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our infrastructure, we are rolling an upgrade for the VMware vCenter Server Appliance solution.
The operation will be done by pool. A communication will be send to inform customers of their specific schedule.

entry.title: [Global][Dedicated Cloud] - End of Life Dedicated Cloud
entry.content:
Dec 20, 10:00 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Jul 25, 13:27 UTC
Scheduled - End of Life Dedicated Cloud: 30 September 2022
We informed you in October 2021 that our Dedicad Cloud service will reach its end of life and will be discontinued the 30st September 2022. This step is important for your VMware platforms to improve the quality of service, performance, and security of your clusters. Indeed, "Dedicated Cloud" hardware used, pre-2016, does not allow us to provide the best level of service and integration with new modern architectures of VMware.
Following our previous email, many customers started to plan and/or to migrate and we encourage you to do the same to avoid the September deadline.

Guide to migrating to a new infrastructure:
https://docs.ovh.com/gb/en/private-cloud/vdc-migration/

entry.title: [RBX2C][Hosted Private Cloud] - R808R21
entry.content:
Dec 17, 21:09 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 17/12/2022 13:52 UTC
End Time : 17/12/2022 18:24 UTC
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Dec 17, 18:55 UTC
Monitoring - Our technical teams have made hardware replacements.
The hosts are now accessible again.
Only the IPMI console will not be available, the dedicated teams are currently working on this.
We will get back to you as soon as possible.

Dec 17, 14:28 UTC
Identified - Start time: 17/12/2022 13:52 UTC
User impact : Some hosts are unreachable
Technical impact (DC/geographical area) : RBX2C
Root cause : This incident is due to a problem with our cooling system.
Ongoing actions : Our teams carry out the de-racking and verification of the impacted servers.

entry.title: [RBX2B][Hosted Private Cloud] - Datastores unreachable
entry.content:
Dec 15, 08:34 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 15/12/2022 06:37 UTC
End Time : 15/12/2022 07:15 UTC
Root cause : The incident is due to a circuit breaker that has tripped.
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Dec 15, 07:15 UTC
Investigating - Start time: 15/12/2022 06:37 UTC
User impact : tete-3311a / tete-3314a / tete-3317a / tete-3318a / tete-3319a / tete-3320a
Technical impact (DC/geographical area) : RBX2B
Scope of impact : These servers are unreachable.
Ongoing Actions: Our teams determine the cause of this unavailability.

Thank you for your understanding

entry.title: [EU][Hosted Private Cloud] - IP Block operations
entry.content:
Dec 14, 08:57 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 13/12/2022 14:00
End Time : 14/12/2022 05:00
Root cause : An ongoing operation caused the delay observed
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Dec 13, 16:43 UTC
Update - Our technical teams identified that the degradation had also affected the public network and all the operations around the IP blocks (purchase, removal etc.).

Dec 13, 16:17 UTC
Investigating - Please note the incident on ipblock from vrack

Following all the necessary information.

Start time: 13/12/2022 14:00
Service impact :Add/Remove of ipblock from vrack can take long times to be performed.
Ongoing Actions:Our technical teams investigate to determine the origin of the degradation

Thank you for your understanding

OVHcloud Technical team
